qas.question: Between what years did Askold and Dir continued to attack Kiev?
What did the attack between Rus and Byzantines lead to?

answers.text: Patriarch to send missionaries north to engage

qas.question: Wat was the purpose of the Patriarch when they were sent north?

answers.text: to convert the Rus' and the Slavs.

qas.question: What years did Askold and Dir make peace with Kiev?

plausible_answers.text: convert the Rus' and the Slavs

qas.question: What was was the purpose of the Patriarch when they were sent south?
What did type of devastation did Patriarch Photius write about the suburbs?

context: <b3_0>The Chronicle<b3_0/> reports that Askold and Dir continued to Constantinople with a navy to attack the city in <a0_0><b4_0>863–66<b4_0/><a0_0/>, catching the Byzantines by surprise and ravaging the surrounding area, though other accounts date the attack in 860. Patriarch Photius vividly describes the "<b6_0>universal<b6_0/>" devastation of the suburbs and nearby islands, and another account further details the destruction and slaughter of the invasion. <b7_0>The Rus<b7_0/>' turned back before attacking the city itself, due either to a storm dispersing their boats, the return of the Emperor, or in a later account, due to a miracle after a ceremonial appeal by the Patriarch and the Emperor to the Virgin. The attack was the first encounter between the Rus' and Byzantines and led the <a1_0>Patriarch to send missionaries north to engage<a1_0/> and attempt <a2_0>to <b5_0>convert the Rus' and the Slavs<b5_0/>.
